data.name: category_explaination_intro_text
data.value: The impact category of a species is determined by the species' invasion potential, combined with its negative ecological effect.

data.name: category_explaination_x_axis_explaination
data.value: The species' invasion potential (x-axis in the impact matrix) is determined by three criteria: the species' median lifetime in Norway (criterion A), the species' expansion speed (criterion B), and the proportion of the total area of an ecosystem colonised by the alien species (criterion C).

data.name: category_explaination_y_axis_explaination
data.value: The species' ecological effect (y-axis in the impact matrix) is determined by six criteria: the species' effects on native species (criteria D and E), the species' effects on ecosystems (criteria F and G), transfer of genetic material to native species (criterion H), and transmission of parasites or pathogens to native species (criterion I).

data.name: category_explaination_heading
data.value: What determines the species' impact category

data.name: alien_species_tables_D_criteria_table_title
data.value: The species' negative effects on threatened or keystone species.

data.name: alien_species_tables_D_criteria_table_text
data.value: The table shows the interaction(s) the alien species has with threatened or keystone species, as well as the interactions' strength and geographical extent. Only effects that are documented in Norway; or documented elsewhere (or for a closely related species) and likely to occur in Norway within 50 years, are included.

data.name: alien_species_tables_E_criteria_table_title
data.value: The species' negative effects on native species that are neither threatened nor keystone.

data.name: alien_species_tables_E_criteria_table_text
data.value: The table shows the interaction(s) the alien species has with native species, as well as the interactions' strength and geographical extent. Only effects that are documented in Norway; or documented elsewhere (or for a closely related species) and likely to occur in Norway within 50 years, are included.

data.name: alien_species_tables_D_criteria_society_table_description
data.value: The table shows the interaction(s) the alien species has with societies of native species (where at least one of the species are either threatened or keystone), as well as the interactions' strength and geographical extent. The negative interaction with a society of species is indicated by the impacted ecosystem. Only effects that are documented in Norway; or documented elsewhere (or for a closely related species) and likely to occur in Norway within 50 years, are included.

data.name: alien_species_tables_D_criteria_society_table_title
data.value: The species' negative effects on societies of native species, including threatened or keystone species.

data.name: alien_species_tables_E_criteria_society_table_description
data.value: The table shows the interaction(s) the alien species has with societies of native species, as well as the interactions' strength and geographical extent. The negative interaction with a society of species is indicated by the impacted ecosystem. Only effects that are documented in Norway; or documented elsewhere (or for a closely related species) and likely to occur in Norway within 50 years, are included.

data.name: alien_species_tables_E_criteria_society_table_title
data.value: The species' negative effects on societies of native species.

data.name: alien_species_tables_F_criteria_table_title
data.value: The species' negative effects on threatened or rare nature types.

data.name: alien_species_tables_G_criteria_table_title
data.value: The species' negative effects on nature types that are neither threatened nor rare.

data.name: alien_species_tables_F_G_criteria_table_description
data.value: The table shows the nature type(s) affected by the alien species now or in the future. Type of state change, the proportion of the nature type's area that are affected and the documentation type is given for each nature type. See guidelines for a description of substantial state change.

data.name: NK_no_decisive
data.value: NK and has no desicive criteria.

data.name: invasion_pot_no_decisive
data.value: The species' score for invasion potential is the lowest score possible, meaning the species has no decisive criteria on the invasion axis.

data.name: category_explaination_decisive_criteria
data.value: The criterion(s) with the highest score on each of the axes in the matrix (invasion potential and ecological effect) are the species' decisive criteria.

data.name: eco_effect_no_decisive
data.value: The species' score for ecological effect is the lowest score possible, meaning the species has no decisive criteria on the effect axis.

data.name: did_not_pass_horizon_scanning
data.value: outside the scope of risk assessment
